title: O Canada! Is this the year the Stanley Cup drought ends?
content: The Edmonton Oilers are looking to become the first Canadian NHL team to hoist the Stanley Cup since 1993.
summary: The Edmonton Oilers are looking to become the first Canadian NHL team to hoist the Stanley Cup since 1993.

title: Netanyahu dismisses cease-fire proposal, angering hostage families
content: European foreign ministers are expressing concern about Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu’s apparent rejection of the proposal and mounting hostilities at the Lebanese border.
summary: European foreign ministers are expressing concern about Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu’s apparent rejection of the proposal and mounting hostilities at the Lebanese border.

title: Princess Anne hospitalized with concussion after apparent horse incident
content: According to a palace source, the medical team concluded that Anne’s injuries were consistent with those delivered by a horse’s head or legs. She is expected to recover.
summary: According to a palace source, the medical team concluded that Anne’s injuries were consistent with those delivered by a horse’s head or legs. She is expected to recover.

title: After attack in Dagestan, Russian officials minimize Islamic State claim
content: Some Russian officials blamed Ukraine and the United States for a terrorist attack in the predominantly Muslim region of Dagestan despite the region’s long legacy of Islamist violence.
summary: Some Russian officials blamed Ukraine and the United States for a terrorist attack in the predominantly Muslim region of Dagestan despite the region’s long legacy of Islamist violence.

title: Travis Kelce carries Taylor Swift across stage, sending fans into frenzy
content: Taylor Swift’s boyfriend, NFL star Travis Kelce, joined her on stage during a surprise Eras Tour appearance at London’s Wembley Stadium.
summary: Taylor Swift’s boyfriend, NFL star Travis Kelce, joined her on stage during a surprise Eras Tour appearance at London’s Wembley Stadium.

title: The pope’s right-hand man is reshaping the church, becoming a target
content: Most Catholics have little sense of the liberal archbishop behind the Vatican’s pronouncements. But critics of the pope see Víctor Manuel Fernández as Enemy No. 2.
summary: Most Catholics have little sense of the liberal archbishop behind the Vatican’s pronouncements. But critics of the pope see Víctor Manuel Fernández as Enemy No. 2.

title: The Philippines needs rice — but young people don’t want to farm it
content: Some 2.4 million Filipinos work as rice farmers. But for young people, a rice farmer’s grueling and often impoverished life holds dwindling appeal.
summary: Some 2.4 million Filipinos work as rice farmers. But for young people, a rice farmer’s grueling and often impoverished life holds dwindling appeal.

title: More than 15 killed in Dagestan, Russia, as gunmen hit multiple sites
content: The dead included a 66-year-old Orthodox priest and over 15 police officers in what appeared to be a coordinated attack at a synagogue, church and police post.
summary: The dead included a 66-year-old Orthodox priest and over 15 police officers in what appeared to be a coordinated attack at a synagogue, church and police post.

title: Israeli defense chief heads to D.C. as Hezbollah escalates threats
content: Fears are growing that border clashes between Israel and the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah could escalate into all-out war, consuming the Middle East.
summary: Fears are growing that border clashes between Israel and the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah could escalate into all-out war, consuming the Middle East.

title: Hajj heat wave deaths underscore climate threat for most vulnerable
content: Many of those who died this month from extreme heat in Saudi Arabia were unregistered pilgrims without access to cooling facilities during the Hajj.
summary: Many of those who died this month from extreme heat in Saudi Arabia were unregistered pilgrims without access to cooling facilities during the Hajj.

title: Iran’s top court overturns death sentence of anti-regime rapper
content: Toomaj Salehi, a rare voice of defiance inside Iran, was sentenced to death over his support for the protests sparked by Mahsa Amini’s death.
summary: Toomaj Salehi, a rare voice of defiance inside Iran, was sentenced to death over his support for the protests sparked by Mahsa Amini’s death.

title: He thought a cow ate his Rolex. It turned up five decades later.
content: James Steele, a British dairy farmer, lost the watch while bringing in his cows for milking in the 1970s.
summary: James Steele, a British dairy farmer, lost the watch while bringing in his cows for milking in the 1970s.

title: Yemen’s Houthis undeterred by U.S. campaign to halt Red Sea attacks
content: Recent attacks by Houthi fighters on commercial ships in the Red Sea have underscored the group’s ability to pose a sustained threat.
summary: Recent attacks by Houthi fighters on commercial ships in the Red Sea have underscored the group’s ability to pose a sustained threat.

title: Israeli airstrikes kill dozens in Gaza City, authorities say
content: Israeli strikes killed 38 people in four neighborhoods Saturday, the Gaza civil defense force said. The military said it struck Hamas infrastructure in the city.
summary: Israeli strikes killed 38 people in four neighborhoods Saturday, the Gaza civil defense force said. The military said it struck Hamas infrastructure in the city.
